metadata.title: CVE-2017-11368 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) 1.7 and later, an authenticated attacker cancause a KDC assertion failure by sending invalid S4U2Self or S4U2Proxyrequests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11368` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.15.1-2
krb5-gss-samples - 1.15.1-2
krb5-k5tls - 1.15.1-2
krb5-kdc - 1.15.1-2
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.15.1-2
krb5-kpropd - 1.15.1-2
krb5-locales - 1.15.1-2
krb5-multidev - 1.15.1-2
krb5-otp - 1.15.1-2
krb5-pkinit - 1.15.1-2
krb5-user - 1.15.1-2
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.15.1-2
libgssrpc4 - 1.15.1-2
libk5crypto3 - 1.15.1-2
libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.15.1-2
libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.15.1-2
libkdb5-8 - 1.15.1-2
libkrad0 - 1.15.1-2
libkrb5-3 - 1.15.1-2
libkrb5support0 - 1.15.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.15.1-2').
